ahrs package

Submodules

ahrs.madgwick module

class ahrs.madgwick.Madgwick(axis, gain, nav_frame='NED')[source]

Bases: object

Madgwick is one of the AHRS filter applied with gradient descent technique [1]

Parameters:

  • axis (int) – axis data for fusion

  • gain (float) – 6 axis fusion gain

  • nav_frame (str) – navigation frame

[1]

‘ahrs <https://ahrs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/filters/madgwick.html#orientation-from-angular-rate>’

gyro_acc_fusion()[source]

Madgwick filter 6 axis data fusion

ENU:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing upwards

Accelerometer in Earth’s reference (m/s^2)

Gyroscope in right hand coordinates (rad/s)

NED:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing downwards

Accelerometer in Earth’s reference (m/s^2)

Gyroscope in right hand coordinates (rad/s)

Returns:

  • w (float) - Quaternion magnitude

  • x (float) - Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) - Quaternion Z axis

gyro_acc_mag_fusion()[source]

Madgwick filter 9 axis data fusion

ENU:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing upwards

Accelerometer in Earth’s reference (m/s^2)

Gyroscope in right hand coordinates (rad/s)

Magnetometer data in Earth’s reference (µT)

NED:

Gravity is defined as negative when pointing downwards

Accelerometer in Earth’s reference (m/s^2)

Gyroscope in right hand coordinates (rad/s)

Magnetometer data in Earth’s reference (µT)

Returns:

  • w (float) - Quaternion magnitude

  • x (float) - Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) - Quaternion Z axis

init_quat(w, x, y, z)[source]

Madgwick filter initial attitude

Parameters:

  • w (float) – Quaternion magnitude

  • x (float) – Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) – Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) – Quaternion Z axis

run(acc, gyr, mag, hz)[source]

Iteration of Madgwick filter

Parameters:

  • acc (ndarray) – accelerometer data

  • gyr (ndarray) – gyroscope data

  • mag (ndarray) – magnetometer data

  • hz (int) – IMU frequency

Returns:

  • w (float) - Quaternion magnitude

  • x (float) - Quaternion X axis

  • y (float) - Quaternion Y axis

  • z (float) - Quaternion Z axis
